summary: This code executes a command using the "node duper-get.js java" string and stores the result in the "result" variable before printing it. It uses the "io.popen" function to open the command and "handle:read('*a')" to read all output from the command execution. The comment suggests replacing local variables with specific functions for more efficient code execution.

details.comment: This code executes a command using the "node duper-get.js java" string and stores the result in the "result" variable before printing it. It uses the "io.popen" function to open the command and "handle:read('*a')" to read all output from the command execution. The comment suggests replacing local variables with specific functions for more efficient code execution.
details.content:
command ="node duper-get.js java"
handle = io.popen(command)
result = handle:read("*a")
handle:close()
-- use local instead of using some functions.
print (result)
